name: ManageAutomationAccountV2DevOpsTask
description: Integration of AAC into DevOps source control and release pipeline
author: GreyCorbel s.r.o.
helpMarkDown: Integration of AAC into DevOps source control and release pipeline

inputs.name: environmentName
inputs.label: Environment name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the stage/environment we're deploying.

inputs.name: projectDir
inputs.label: Project directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Root folder of automation account content.

inputs.name: subscription
inputs.label: Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the subscription where automation account is located.

inputs.name: azureSubscription
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of service connection with contributors rights for defined subscription.

inputs.name: resourceGroup
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the resource group where automation account is located.

inputs.name: automationAccount
inputs.label: Automation account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of automation account that we deploy to.

inputs.name: storageAccount
inputs.label: Storage account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of storage account used for uploading of private modules to automation account. Caller must have permission to: - upload blobs, - create SAS tokens for uplaoded blobs. Not needed if private modules not used.

inputs.name: storageAccountContainer
inputs.label: Storage account container
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of blob container where to upload private modules to. SAS token valid for 2 hours is then created a used to generate content link for module, so as automation account can use it to upload module to itself. Needed when StorageAccount specified.

inputs.name: fullSync
inputs.label: Full sync
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether or not to remove any existing runbooks and variables from automation account that are not source-controlled.

inputs.name: reportMissingImplementation
inputs.label: Report missing implementation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to report missing implementation file. Note: it may be perfectly OK not to have implementation file, if artefact is meant to be used just in subset of environments.
